review_title: Good benefits and pay, but that's about it.
pros:
-The compensation and benefits are outstanding. You get a defined-benefit pension, plus a strong 401k match. 
-Health benefits are okay. A little expensive, but that's common these days.
-The projects you work on can be interesting at times, mostly because of their size.
-The focus on continuous improvement will strengthen your own skills. 
-Nice Christmas party.
-Tickets to sporting events.
cons:
-Management is often inexperienced and more concerned about covering themselves rather than developing your career. 
-It's the old boys club, where white males do best.
-You cannot rock the boat at all. If you bring up an idea in a meeting, your superiors will dismiss it and make it a point to make you look stupid in front of the entire group. If you actually do have a good idea or improvement, someone (maybe your manager) will take all of the credit while you do all of the work.
-Promises are made and broken. Do X and Y, and we'll get you a promotion, but when time comes to get that person promoted it comes down to favoritism and your manager's ability to influence. 
-The ranking system emphasizes politics rather actual performance. You can do nothing, but if you suck up to the right people and tell them how great you are, you're in the top 10%. Meanwhile, others that actually add value get ranked in the bottom third or are shown the door. The remaining cohort is full of politicians who can't get anything done because the real workers left or got pushed out.
-Long hours are expected. If you're inefficient, but stay until 6 or 7, you get a pat on the back. Those that are more efficient are shunned.

pros: The compensation and other benefits including pension, scholarships and volunteer matching program are first rate.  There is extensive training and tools to use. It is a global company with many business units.  ExxonMobil is very diverse and has a strong culture.

review_title: Gender discrimination...  My boss treated my like garbage because I was a girl and then fired me when I got pregnant
job_title: Lube Technician/Customer Service in De Pere, WI
pros: The only thing good about that job was I got paid and learning some new mechanical stuff.  THAT'S IT...
cons:
The challenges of working at Mobil 1 existed because I was a girl.  Management talked town to me as if i were stupid or beneath them.  Everyone I worked with completely disregarded the relevant qualifications i possessed for the very position that I was hired for by having me do the work no one else wanted to do.  Like mop the floors or clean the bathrooms.  When I actually got a change to do the job that I was hired for…  My boss would immediately undermined my actions or efforts by manipulating the situation leaving me in a position where I had to choice but to rely on my peers to do my job…  So that way I'd always be inferior.   My boss was controlling and discriminatory.   When I got pregnant by boss all of a sudden treated me with constant dislike.  He was always short with me and got extremely irritated by everything I did…  Then at one point my boss told me that I had to sign a document stating that I willingly agree to a voluntary layoff starting at 3 months pregnant until after I had my baby.  After that I regularly asked him about seeing the document and he always said that he didn't have it or he needed to get it still…  I never saw that document because three weeks later I was fired for "poor work quality" without every justifying why or what I ever did.

I called the Mobil headquarters and asked them about all of it…  They told me there is no such thing as a voluntary layoff at 3 months pregnant company policy and that anyone that's pregnant are allowed to work all the way up till the day the baby is born if the mother chooses.  

So in a nutshell…  I was discriminated against for both being a girl and being pregnant.  I was was also wrongfully let go.

cons: There’s no benefits and you won’t get a raise more than likely. There are some regulars there that aren’t great either, they will purposely try to ruin your day.

pros: Company is stable which is good for people who value job security. Most everyone one in the company is process-oriented. Most everyone I have worked with is talented and motivated.
cons: The company can be slow to move to make changes, which hinders them when there are disruptive forces in the marketplace. Needs improvement with information technology.

pros: Good experience and learning. Some opportunity to travel
cons: Useless managers unable to find and retain the right people. Rigid structure, changes are super slow to implement. Conformity and narrow mindedness rewarded, while creativity and risk taking punished.

review_title: ExxonMobil is a unique cultural standard that improves your professional and personal skills.
pros:
Long term vision and stability.
Great benefits for their employees.
Industry leader, marking the pace in safety and operational practices.
Great amount of resources available to facilitate performance and improvement.
cons: Sometimes, decisions takes longer than necessary.

review_title: Secure, good pay - work life balance skewed to compete.
pros: Total compensation is great. Insurance is just okay. Interesting field to work in.
cons: Competitive culture. Every salary employee gets ranked against one another. A lot of extra programs and work on top of base job is expected.

pros: Excellent company, great benefits and pay.
cons: Very unfair rating and ranking system, very corporate.

pros: Great pay and benefits.  Really very easy work.  Actually too easy.  I felt like I was doing the same thing over and over again and not learning.
cons: Very political environment.  If you don't value the environment and believe that oil will never be challenged by other fuels, you'll be fine.  If you have an open mind you are going to have a tough time in this culture.

review_title: Great experience in retail and customer service
pros: Great coworkers as everyone is working towards the same goal, willing to help each other, flexible hours and management willing to work around people's schedules.
cons: Having to deal with customer after customer, top heavy as the best workers do the most work. Low pay compared to other jobs.

job_title: Senior Audit & Controls Advisor in Intl Falls, MN
pros:
Very high standard of staff.
Very good policies and business controls.
Plenty of scope for travel
Share sceheme and pension (UK) are good.
cons: Okay if you just want a job but there is limited career opportunity and you have no control over your next assignment. It is all decided for you behind closed doors. Can be a stressful place to work (very political).

pros: Stability, work life balance, benefits, location, travel, technology, trainings, old school management, clear mission, vision and processes, upstream, downstream, gas, worldwide locations
cons: Long term career , inclusion , diversity, US company for US employees, harassment, males, not value people from different backgrounds, if you are not an engineer do not enter

review_title: Was the best company to work with.
job_title: Windows Server Administrator in Kuala Lumpur
pros: Offers career advancements if you are with the right "team". Good people to work with. Open office promotes employees to collaborate and work better as a team.
cons: If you were from a company with no or less segregation of duties, you will find it hard to work here.

pros: Very good compensation and benefits.
cons: The performance system is designed to reward people who bested their peers. Culture is cut throat and competitive. Politics is critical to succeed  for all levels of the hierarchy. Backstabbing is a norm. Have not met a person who doesn't know the exact date they can retire with full pension.

review_title: Used to be a good company
pros: Stability and option to move to completely different positions throughout the career. Ranking system may also discourage people to deliver more as it could be quite unfair
cons: Salary increase plan got worse over the years and many good people were fired instead of people who work there longer but dont deliver as much

review_title: Very good company who take care of employees
pros: Very good work environment - Multicultural, a lot of challenges. A lot of trainings, excellent benefits (language courses, massages, gym cards, etc...). I would recommend for a young people right after studies as a first work experience.
cons: Salary, bad structure of salary raise, limited business travels.

pros:
challenging engineering field
very professional
90% oversea graduate with top class 
everything processed quickly
cons:
underpaid, unless you are getting oversea assignment which is one in a million.
not recommended for non-technical position since all is in contract basis.

review_title: Great place to grow and figure out what you want to be when you grow up!
pros:
401k match
Pension plan
Extremely competent coworkers continuing to improve and challenge each other
Multiple career paths and flexibility to try something new
cons: Old school-culture and assessment processes, lots of effort to change that but senior management has been rewarded through old processes so extremely slow!

review_title: A company that believes in treating their employees fairly and encourages work-life balance.
pros: They believe in their people and offer a wide variety of additional training to build the people assets of the company.
cons: This company is very aware of legal policies and at times is difficult to get things done because of the many levels of approvals needed.

pros:
Upper end salary and benefits
Will rotate jobs many times giving good overview of how business ticks
cons:
Interns get left with the jobs no one else wants to do (and sometimes aren't recognised for the time some of these sorts of jobs take)
People move jobs too quickly for continuity to be established
Attrition

pros: Very high technical standard set in all area of oil and gas with great people to work with. Great company for strong and highly talented new hires to develop their technical skill-sets.
cons: Company is getting too large and has large company challenges for new entrant..

pros: Great work environment. Encouraging management and promising projects to work on.
cons: It takes very long to be promoted within this organization, which does not mean it is not worth the wait but that it is not an easy thing to handle if you are seeking a promotion in the near future.

pros: They are very helpful in helping you to understand how to get the job done. Friendly and fun environment.
cons: The possibility of disgruntled customers every once and a while.

pros: The party is above average.  We recurve paid holidays.  The health insurance is just ok
cons: Sometimes there is not much overtime.  Nit enough pretty woman work for the company.  No profit sharing

review_title: Great company, highly competitive, long commute.
pros:
Multiple opportunities with frequent rotation all within one company, maintaining existing benefits plan eliminates need for frequent job hunting. 

Global company with oppositions on nearly every continent.
cons: Campus move out of Houston to Spring is a burden for many who don't want to be forced to live in the suburbs.

pros: I learned a lot at ExxonMobil. I definitely feel greater prepared to continue my career in the oil and gas industry.
cons:
Management plays favorites. If you are not in the "in" crowd, you are out. There  are a lot of cliques.
There is no room for promotions.

pros: Lots of opportunities to wear "different hats" and try out a number of job roles. There are also more opportunities as more and more employees retire.
cons: Work culture is less than ideal for women and minorities (lots of unconscious biases), though things are changing. Also, the forced ranking system inhibits collaboration and makes many employees unhappy.

pros: Strong support for career development; competitive benefits including pension plan; beautiful campus in Spring, TX; values employees as people; flexible work schedule; work-life balance
cons: Lack of urgency; negative perceptions of industry and company by public; many layers of review for all decisions; hard to make large contributions as individual contributor; slow placed

pros: Pay, pension, ability to move departments, training opportunities, co-workers, great benefits
cons: Can be too competitive, ranking system, abundance of corporate processes

job_title: Cashier and Stocker in East Bend, NC
pros: Nice people to work with and the customers were really nice when they came in to buy something
cons: The owners weren’t there a lot of times and they tell us to do one thing and we do it and then they turn around and tells us somin different

review_title: All about self-marketing and sellling individual agenda
pros: Relaitvely good salary, no heavy workload. Can ride-along people's project.
cons: No recognition for technical people.  Bad place for fresh grad to develop technical skills. Loss of individuality due to people taking credit of each other's work

review_title: Great place to learn, bad place to succeed.
job_title: Cashier in White Bear Lake, Optional[MN]

cons: Would never get a raise. Never get promotions. Hard work would go unnoticed. Co-workers were incompetent. Management was terrible.

pros: Vast experience in Oil sector, New projects always implemented and always looking to improve Production quality and supply. Implementation of OIMS and ISO Standards.
cons: Time line for the projects is highly observed by the higher authorities and must complete the project on time. Always be active for the audits and must comply procedures and certifications.

pros: People were nice and the environment was friendly to new grads.  The management structure is not as well design as other companies, but we still get our work done.
cons: The company is less focused on the care of the environment and the care of its employees.  Pay was okay, but could have been more.

pros: Offered a great training budget which a lot employees didn't seem to take advantage of.
cons: Very difficult to work your way up without a degree. You either had to be willing to wait until you had 10 years experience with them or leave (both real outcomes).

review_title: Worked in technology, business and manufacturing within chemicals

cons: No 9-80s. Very demanding and competitive within work groups. Facilities are old and need of a revamp like the new campus.

good benefits
chance to work with latest technology
stability
safe work environment

bureaucracy

forced ranking process which
large difference in management style

pros: Supportive management and the company dedicates a lot of time to your professional development. In addition, the employees at Exxon are generally extremely supportive and approachable.

pros: Great place to learn, you'll be surrounded by smart and good people.  The culture is great if you like organization and structure.
cons: It can be difficult to get promoted from certain roles.  Over the long-run the company treats you fairly, but you may have to wait years for your salary to catch-up to your peers.

review_title: Management acts as tyrant - health risks/shift work not worth it

People want to see you succeed

review_title: Attracts highly intelligent workforce, but the best people leave after a few years due to terrible work environment.

review_title: Got scholarship to study Master Degree aboard.
